channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hundreds of Rwandans who fled to Congo after the 1994 genocide return home
item.description: The U.N. refugee agency said it helped repatriate 360 Rwandan refugees, mostly women and children, as part of a broader plan to return about 2,000 peo...

item.title: Ritual, symbol and a popemobile tour mark Pope Leo XIV's installation Mass
item.description: Leaders from around the world will be in attendance, including Vice President JD Vance, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, and Peruvian Presiden...

item.title: Fatal First Date
item.description: A couple’s first date ends with an ambush. Both are shot. Can the only survivor identify the shooter? "48 Hours" correspondent Erin Moriarty reports.

item.title: Pop culture re-invented the Menendez brothers - but can it set them free?
item.description: The brothers' fate will now be in the hands of California's Parole Board and Governor Gavin Newsom.

item.title: Two dead as Mexican Navy ship crashes into Brooklyn Bridge
item.description: At least 19 people are injured after the towering masts of training sailboat clip New York City's famous bridge.

item.title: Missing hiker found in California mountains says she survived on wild leeks, snowmelt
item.description: A Georgia woman who went missing for weeks in California's Sierra Nevada said that she was trapped by an avalanche and survived off wild leeks and sno...

item.title: Fatal blast near Palm Springs fertility clinic 'act of terrorism' - FBI
item.description: One person was killed and four injured in Saturday's explosion outside the American Reproductive Centers.

item.title: Four days that took India and Pakistan to the brink
item.description: The BBC visits families in Kashmir devastated by the deadliest clashes in years, and speaks to military insiders.

item.title: India's forgotten actor who lost her legacy to caste oppression
item.description: PK Rosy, the first actress in Malayalam cinema, was hounded out of her home after playing the role of an upper caste woman.

item.title: FBI: Blast near Palm Springs fertility clinic "an intentional act of terrorism"
item.description: Palm Springs Police Chief Andy Mills reported that one person was killed in an incident that "appears to be an intentional act of violence."

item.title: At least 18 killed as severe weather lashes Kentucky, and 9 more die elsewhere
item.description: Severe storms across parts of the U.S. Midwest and South have left at least 27 people dead. Kentucky Gov.

item.title: 2 dead after Brooklyn Bridge hit by Mexican navy ship, Eric Adams says
item.description: Two people died and more than a dozen were hurt when a Mexican navy ship hit the Brooklyn Bridge on Saturday in New York City, officials said.

item.title: 5/17: Saturday Morning
item.description: Manhunt continues for seven inmates who broke out of a Louisiana jail, three others caught; Husband and wife duo craft Masala y Maíz, a Mexico City ho...

item.title: Paleontologists discover a 500-million-year-old, 3-eyed predator
item.description: Fossils of the underwater predator shed new light on biodiversity from the Cambrian period.

item.title: Photos: Deadly tornadoes hit Kentucky and Missouri
item.description: Over 20 people have died since severe storms and tornadoes hit Kentucky and Missouri overnight. Meteorologists are beginning to survey the damage.

item.title: Fatal explosion outside fertility clinic was 'intentional,' police say
item.description: At least one person was killed in the explosion that damaged the fertility clinic, authorities said. The FBI said the explosion was "intentional act o...

item.title: Critics blast hourslong gap before officials disclosed 10 inmates’ escape from New Orleans jail
Mexican tall ship strikes Brooklyn Bridge, snapping masts and killing 2 crew members
